description:
I had the Grilled Cheez Guy at Faction Brewery a few weeks ago and I loved it! Unfortunately, the day we went, it was super windy and the food truck had to bring their items in doors.... so they ended up having a limited menu which wasn't a bad thing.

I ordered the nachos which was basically a grilled cheese cut up into small triangles. The difference? It's not your basic b----- grilled cheese! This one has a homemade sauce that gives a kick to it. Ok. Have you ever had a quesadilla from Taco Bell? You know the creamy jalepeno sauce inside? It has that vibe, but better!

I definitely plan on making my next trip to Faction when The Grilled Cheez Guys are on the calendar.
author: Love K.

description:
Terrible.

Just Terrible.

And it got even more Terrible after having words with the owner Mike D.

All I intended to do was find a locally sourced and organic half gluten (that's one slice of regular bread and the other side gluten free bread for those who don't know) and mostly lactose free grilled chesse (that's an 85% lactose free mixed with 15% regular cheese).

Mike D thinks I'm joking, or mishears me, and then proceeds to make me a grilled cheese sandwich with the works (that's where they load it with bacon, avo, arugula, etc, etc, etc).
Was it delicious?  Yes!
Properly buttery yet crisp?  Yes!
Took grilled cheese to another level?  Yes!
And all the while partnering up with other local and artisan food makers?  Yes!

He then has the nerve to only charge me $6 because it's a free grilled cheese day.  Jeez.

Ban me if you will, Mike D, I dare you.  I will gladly stand by the countless other reviewers who refuse to take your fair criticism about their reviews as well as your tasty creations.

I mean who do you think you are moving into Stevens Alley to serve up finely crafted grillz, occasionally feed the downtrodden, and have a free grilled cheese day once a month?

By the way, does anyone know when the next free grilled cheese day is?
author: Dan B.

description:
This place is A-OK (i.e. the moniker associated with 3-stars on Yelp).  It was an enjoyable lunch as grilled cheese usually is.  Definitely appreciate that they take creative chances on their menu.  I think the key is to keep trying their innovations and you're bound to discover something new that you like.

Nacho Guyz: A bunch of nacho shaped grilled cheese sandwiches begotten from a larger baguette grilled cheese.  The choice of baguette for bread that is pressed makes for a very crunchy sandwich.  I normally prefer a softer grilled cheese, but the texture was well suited to the nachos shtick.  There was guacamole and salsa on the side for dipping.  It felt more quesadilla-esqe than nacho-esqe, but still tasty because cheese.
author: Adam B.

description:
Such a weird and great little place! The location is less than ideal... but it really doesn't matter. 
They had a promotion on today that I randomly saw and I'm so glad that I did. I ordered a Gouda grill cheese with red pepper and arugula (smothered in sriracha because I'm a demon) and my god it's good. The sandwiches are $6 ish which I think is very reasonable! They're made fresh right in front of you by a friendly and jokey team of three who seem to just enjoy what they do. 
100% recommend if you're anywhere near the area and looking for lunch. You can customise your sandwich with loads of fillings (tomato, avo, bacon..) They also sell potato chips as well as the usual lot of soft drinks.
author: Poppy C.

description: San Francisco has a little magical hidden paradise tucked away off Market in SOMA.  You'll find things there that you didn't expect to ever find.  The Grilled CheezGuy is situated in this magical part of San Francisco.  Rewards are handed to the brave that put their skepticism aside and venture into the neighborhood.  I loved the grilled cheese!  I liked the vibe of the place, and I adore the sarcastic owner with this edgy sense of humor - not everyone get it - but for those of us who do, it adds to the great experience.  I believe in supporting local businesses, specially those that give back to the community.  Keep it up CheezGuy!
author: Inked I.

description: I want to say THANK YOU to guy with the long hair for hooking me up at the stop light (tow truck life)!!!! The sandwich was really tasty and delicious that pickle onions to die for and all of the above best believe I will be visiting you guys soon THANK YOU
author: Chuy H.

description: I've been eating these sandwiches for a long time at nerdnite, and they're absolutely killer! Easiest order, get the classic with the works and a bunch of jalapeno jelly
author: Joe S.

description:
Grilled cheese Sammy with bacon  for $11 not too bad and pretty hearty ( large pieces of bread). I had not had a grilled cheese for awhile so this one hit the spot! 

It seemed to be pretty popular at the event I attended so I wouldn't hesitate to try them again.
author: Rod M.

description: First time coming into this shop. I must say I was left in shocked. Grilled cheese sandwich is a classic. Add a few extra ingredients and the results are phenomenal. I recommend this place to anyone that wants a grilled cheese with a lively fresh taste.
author: Antonio A.

description:
Cheesy.
Gooey.
Buttery.
Crunchy.
Goodness.

(with arugula added)

I was sharing with two "plain Janes" so I stuck with the classic and asked for arugula on the side.  Next time I'm getting one all for my self.  And it's gonna have it allll on there.... lol.
author: Heidi D.

description:
My hopes were very very high after stocking all the Instagram and yelp pictures of the grilled cheez guy. The sandwiches looked like a true work of art. At presidio picnic on Sunday, the stand has 3 items on the menu: classic, kids grilled cheese, and nachos. You could add on items such as basil, arugula,bacon, tomato, pickled onions, candied jalapeños, etc. The standard price was $9 and you could add on all toppings for $6 (or $1-$2 individually). The sandwich comes in 3 pieces and it is very filling (basically a sandwich and a half). About my creation: beautifully grilled acme bread, 3 types of cheese, tomato, basil, arugula, and pickled onions. Also added sriracha aioli from the condiment bar. $13. The grilled cheese was very good but I think I'd rather have had one of their menu items that I've seen on the website (Nino I'm looking at you).  Would have loved to see  on the topping list or a grilled cheese with Brie and hot pepper jam. Line is long but service is super quick. 

For all you families out there trying to enjoy your picnic Sunday, this place is very kid friendly with a kids grilled cheese that comes with fruit snacks and a Capri sun juice box.
author: Kara N.

description:
Saw Grilled Cheez at Off the Grid Presidio on a Sunday and had to get one of their sandwiches! I'd only seen them as pop ups before.

I was dead set on a grilled peach with goat cheese but turns out that wasn't a grilled cheese - literally a grilled half peach with cheese. My friend got it and it was very delicious (I think drizzled with honey), but I was craving a sandwich.

I got:
* The Classic (with added bacon, their sriracha & tomato dipping sauces, $11) - 4 stars
This was great! They toast their bread quite hard, and after seeing some other people get their Classic I should have added arugula for some freshness, but overall delicious.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Damn, what a bomb ass sandwich! I just wish they had more cheese and other fillings in it to make it worth the money. 1st time, got the classic with bacon for my boyfriend and El Niño for myself. I expected a little more cheese and jalapeños in my sandwich. The taste of it is great, no doubt about it but lacking amount for the price given, like even including a small bag of chips may make it worth it. Location sucks, and glad I found it on Yelp. If the portion gets better, I'd definitely keep coming.
author: Anita P.

description:
Excellent catered food and great service!!

I've hired the Grilled Cheez Guy to serve their melty magic at two events -- a work cocktail party for 50+ and a family birthday party for 15 guests -- and both were big successes. 

They set up in a bar's courtyard for the work event and continuously served up four different sandwich varieties over a 2 hr timeframe. 

They set up just as handily in a driveway for the home event and supplied ample quantities of three different sandwiches, plus arugula salad and a couple appetizers. 

No doubt...they are generous with the cheese and butter/oil, but you kinda know that going in. The salad call was one I worried about, and it was excellent. 

Most recently, we ordered:
Classic GC -- delish
Mechanical Turk -- a meal of goodness
Bacon tomato -- can't stop

I found their prices reasonable...probably something like $15-20 per head for three types of GC plus two apps and salad. 

The cooker/servers have been very friendly and cleanly. Danny led the crew from Oakland and was fantastic. Michael and Ricky were easy to work with reserving and picking out the menu. 

Don't miss tip:  Their "nachos" of mini grilled cheese sandos on sliced baguette with salsa are off the hook good!!  Make sure you ask for summa that action.
author: Lanny B.

description: I think that their restaurant location could throw you off, but they are one of the best grilled cheese sandwich places that I have had food from. I heard the cook mention about getting in more from the food truck scene on Fridays. But I think their store is cool for a pickup if you work close to 6th and Market. I got the Mexican salsa flavored sandwich(forget the exact name). It was spicy and delicious. I recommend this place.
author: Subbu V.

description:
I've been stalking these guys around the Bay at various breweries and festivals for a couple years now. I wish I lived closer to downtown so I could make it in, but today was my first time visiting their brick and mortar. And I have to say -- these grilled cheeses are the greatest I've ever had in my life. The technique of taking a thick grilled cheese and smooshing it down to get the greatest crisp and texture is simply genius. 

The ingredients are top notch, too; start off with just the classic and toss any kind of topping, from bacon, avocado, pickled onion, arugula -- and slather it with some top quality sriracha. Or get the sandwich with "the works" like I always do and turn that grilled cheese into the greatest loaded sandwich.

And not only do they make the best grilled cheeses in the world, they're decent members of their community, doing free grilled cheese days meant to give back to their local community and help the homeless get fed. 

Top notch food, top quality guys, and always a pleasure to have a sandwich whenever I see them. Literally -- if I see their popup or am near their store, even if I'm not hungry, I'll still buy a sandwich from them. It's that freakin' good.
author: Sam M.

description: Grilled Cheez Guy just came to my workplace and it was really good, I liked the Habanero jam on the side..BOMB
author: Stephen W.

description: Delicious grilled cheese with good service and good sense of humor. Def recommend the classic with bacon
author: Katie M.

description: The food was okay, but unfortunately the owner was incredibly rude. Looking at his responses to other customers on here, it seems like that's kind of the standard. The food isn't enough to overcome the poor attitude, unfortunately!
author: Shaughnessy N.

description: These guyz are great. Great food, great shop, great people. Don't let the alley scare you, your stomach will thank you.
author: Joseph M.

description: Hands down the best grilled cheese I ever had by far! Everything on the menu is delicious and the service is great. So happy that the grilled cheese guy opened a shop!
author: Jon E.

description:
The Truck was parked across the street from the pub my girlfriends and I meet at once a week. They were there for some kind of pre school event I think? Lots of littles running all around. They had rubbed off most of the menu on the dry erase board! 

I ordered 2 of  the basic with pickled onions and bacon. Walked 4 blocks home in the fog. They stayed warm and melty. DELICIOUS!
author: Amanda L.

description:
I will not be going back again. I'm surprised more people don't get sick from this place. The guy cooking the grill cheese has rubber gloves which is great. But those gloves should only touch food! He is setting up a table that is touching the ground on the sides and then starts checking sandwiches with the same gloves. That is a Health Hazzard all the way. That just makes me wonder what goes on when they prep all the sandwiches before they get here at Tesla. Some tell the guy Spice Girls want there shoes back !!
 Last time Feb. 6th 2018
author: Raymond H.

description:
YES.

This is not going to be a fair review, because I have not been to this location, but tried their Classic + the works (avocado, bacon, basil, tomato, arugula, pickled onions, BUT I requested no peppers) at a Gravity Fest in Berkeley... which was today... yeah that was fast.

This is the best (thanks to all the toppings) grilled cheese I have EVER eaten. I love cheese, but hate grease. The grilled cheese sandwich I had today was not greasy! Someone mentioned earlier that they use acme bread. This is toasted to satisfaction with crispiness on the outside and sides. Lovely. I do not feel bad about devouring this one month before my wedding (again, thank you for all the toppings for making it healthy(er)).

What makes Grilled Cheez Guy even better is their condiments. Habanero pepper jelly and Barrel-aged sriracha? Yes pleeeeease :)
author: Andrea S.

description:
This sounds cheesy but this place is cheese-tastic. 
This isn't your basic dip in some tomato soup grilled cheese but an explosion of customizable goodness!
Great for a quick lunch and awesome friendly staff. Nice to get something different :)
author: Alan M.

description: I initially had really high hopes for this place but I have to say, I was quite disappointed. The grilled cheeses here are quite overpriced for what you're given. You're looking at close to $15 for a grilled cheese with a few toppings which seems a bit ridiculous (although I will admit their portion sizes are quite generous). The taste was mediocre - and I'm pretty sure I saw at least a few health violations when I was there...
author: Cassie Z.

description: Grilled Cheez Guy is often at Nerd Nite at Rickshaw Stop. I got a sandwich for the second time tonight. Because it was the owner's bday, he had a discounted menu. It was $5 base price for sandwich plus $1 for a topping. So I had the Frenchy and got tomatoes with it. It had gruyere cheese and grilled onions. It was very good. I used the gooey jam. The owner says they are opening a storefront at 6th and Market in a month...he says also free sandwich days once a month! Wahoo! I love Grilled Cheez Guy!
author: Denise C.

description:
Okay so the sandwiches are ridiculously good. Nuff said. Better still the guy? From Jersey... funny in hat east coast way. 

He is in business to make money like any of us but he is deeper. He is in an interesting part of the hood and on purpose. His free sandwich days are intended to help feed the homeless he donates left overs and rejects to the homeless and he is doing right by his employees. 

So visit for the super good lunch go back and support him and the city and his causes. He is a good man. Period. 

Do the right thing people. And get some good food.

The first annual grilled cheese eating contest was a riot too.
author: Music S.

description: Quick grilled cheese yums. And super nice people work there. They got fancy bread too.
author: Ezra T.

description: Hole in the wall type of place. Good grilled cheese for a quick lunch. It's just behind my office so I will come back another time :)
author: Vy T.

description: hectic crowdedazz night #firstfridays #oakland i walk out a resto n see some bruh pushing a huge cooler w no wheels down the middle of the street. guess i couldn't stand the sight of #thestruggle bc i walked str8 into his path and took the front handle asking if he wanted help. expected him to take the other handle n we pick up the cooler but we ended up sliding it like he'd been doing. (must be why he was skinny in the first place - he don't lift.) thought i was helping him bring hegga beers to like a house party #kidnplay; we stopped & i looked up to see a tent. "what is this - what'd i help deliver?" trick opens the cooler: tonsa grilled cheese ingreds lol. well y'all muhfuhs are welcome.
author: Dan B.

description: Amazing, recommend this place 100%. I really love the grilled cheese nachos and the montly specials they have. Check their facebook page for the once a month free grilled cheese sandwich day.
author: Ene M.

description: You may see their tent at food festival or a concert, and walk right past it thinking, "grilled cheese?!? I can do that it my own home. How good can it be?", but I promise you it's the same way your overconfident friend thinks he's a couple crunches and a few sprints away from being a pro athlete. This will be the best grilled cheese you've ever eaten. They are simply on another level: A professional athlete to your JV glory days. Get "the works" or simply the candied jalapeños (made by hand) and bacon, smear on the barrel aged sriracha, and enjoy.
author: David G.

description: $11 for a cheese sandwich with tomato. That is crazy! The food was good but not very filling. Also, the staff wasn't super helpful or friendly. I would not recommend this restaurant unless you're absolutely dying for a grilled cheese and willing to spend high prices.
author: Nicole S.

description:
"One of the best grilled cheese sandwiches I've ever had!"

Needless to say, that's a fairly hefty statement to make...yet it's no less true!

Now, how Grilled Cheez Guy hasn't gotten more publicity/reviews is beyond me.  I mean, it's not like they're slinging out those (gross) Kraft grilled cheese sandwiches people!  These babies are huge, cheesy, and, most importantly, DELICIOUS!

After doing a quick lap to check out Presidio Picnic's offerings, we knew we had to go back to the Grilled Cheez Guy stand when we saw person after person clutching onto their sandwiches.  Although there were only three different types available (Classic, Ham & Cheezy, Pastrami), they all sounded terrific.  Good thing my friend was down to split a couple!

-- HAM & CHEEZY - Ham, Muenster, Cheddar, Horseradish Sour Cream...$11
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/grilled-cheez-guy-san-francisco?select=3ptDpKTTc-yJZk1YzIinkw)
Even though it tasted light on the muenster (it was cheesy, just cheddar heavy), they certainly didn't skimp on the ham.  It may not sound like much, but those four or five slices gave this a very meaty feel.  While the mix of flavors was very solid (and classic), that side of horseradish sour cream was perfect to help cut the sandwich's overall richness.

-- PASTRAMI - SF Pastrami, Swiss, Arugula, Pickled Red Onion...$11
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/grilled-cheez-guy-san-francisco?select=-xCHxjuHHanxbcBt4QNmeA)
As good as the Ham & Cheezy was, this was the star.  Not only was it even meatier, but it was just as cheesy and tasted even better.  The pastrami was both juicy and flavorful, and I liked the balance the arugula and pickled red onions added.  If this also had the same horseradish sour cream, it would've been perfect!

While both sandwiches were obviously delicious, the bread they use is what really puts them over the top.  Unfortunately, I'm not sure what type they use (looks like ACME though).  However, on the outside, the crust on both was buttery (yet not too greasy) and had the ideal crunchiness to them.  On the inside, the bread was pretty soft and moist (which the cheese probably had something to do with).

Besides how awesome these sandwiches are, the one thing I'd point out is how the hours listed on their Yelp page aren't very accurate (it only lists Sundays).  Instead, check out their Twitter to find out where they'll be and when (even their website is outdated).  Besides that, I have nothing bad to say about them.  Well, except that now, all future grilled cheese sandwiches I try will be measured against a relatively high bar.  Seriously, liked I said...Grilled Cheez Guy really does make one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches I've ever had!
author: Mike L.

description: This CheezGuy is located right behind where I work. Every so often I go in there and they happen to be giving away free grilled cheezes. Which is pretty insane to me, but hey! if I only have to pay for my arugula & basil toppings, I'm not complaining! I love the crunch of the bread, I love the cheez of the cheese, I love the specialty ketchup, and I love that they don't force an apple fruit into my grilled cheez meal (like unnamed other cheesy businesses do... I choose my constipated lifestyle, thankyouverymuch!!)
author: Hannah J.

description:
A coworker told me about their free sandwich promotion today as it is their opening day, so we stopped by. 

The sandwich was a pretty standard grilled cheese and the wait was about 20 minutes which is fine given that this a special promotion on their opening day. 

The main reason for the lower star rating is the person who was acting as promoter/cashier. 

While I was in line, a woman stroller through asking about their bread and whether it was gluten free, and his obnoxious response was that their bread was gluten free and for her to tell all of her "freak friends" about it. She was disgusted to say the least and like her, after today, I will not be returning to this establishment as many folks in my life are gluten intolerant and I do not support such disrespectful and discriminatory behavior.

Furthermore, there was a gentleman in front of us who may have been of lower socioeconomic status and this same employee made it very apparent that he did not want this customer there. The customer paid for optional additional toppings, and was so polite, going so far as to try to trigger a light sensor that turned off while in line and even wrote a good luck sign on a napkin for them before leaving. It really broke my heart to see such blatant classism taking place. He is a person and deserves as much respect as my coworkers and I do.
author: Ashley M.

description: Michael and team have donated appetizers to our Team Fox SF event (benefiting the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research) for two years in a row, and they are always a hit! They've provided delicious cheese and crackers along with the tastiest jam ever. We greatly appreciate the fact that they support their community and highly recommend them as a business! They recently opened up a new location close to my office and I can't wait to try it out.
author: Kristen B.

description: This is hands down the best grilled cheese in the city. Creme de la creme - top shelf! I've been before and I'll 100% be again. These guys rock. So much customer love coming from behind the counter
author: Sam G.

description: Grilled cheese so good it makes you wanna slap yo mama! I'll definitely go back. The staff was really great too, super friendly
author: Derrick Cosmo W.

description: Reviewing their stand at Faction brewery. There is almost no line and yet it takes them over 30 minutes to heat up a pre-made grilled cheese. Part of the reason is if the check out guy liked you he would have the cooks make yours first, skipping everyone who was patiently waiting for their basic grilled cheese. They get 2 stars because the grilled cheese was tasty enough (they only had ham and cheezy's left and i got one plain and one with tomatoes and arugula); however, there is nothing special or unique about it. It is just a pretty good grilled cheese. And a pretty good grilled cheese is definitely not worth a 30-40 min wait.
author: Sean M.

description: Thank you The GrilledCheezGuy for being apart of AGSA's 15th Anniversary Closing Ceremonies! We were referred The GrilledCheezGuy from parents who attended a school fall festival, and appreciate you guys fitting us in to your schedule to come onsite for our event. Soooooo many compliments from players and families on the great service, quick turnaround time and delicious sandwiches! We hope to have you at many more Alameda events in the future! Thanks again!
author: Mari H.

description: I tried this place for the first time today. I tried out the nacho sandwich and it was amazing. best sandwich I've had in a long time. The meat tasted juicy and the vegetables tasted fresh. I opted to add spice and everything felt complete. The sandwich is worth the price and highly recommend you go here if you're in the area.
author: Jose S.

description: The one star is not a testament for the food, but for the poor attitude from the staff/owner, who effectively lost his temper at my group for "not telling them how we heard of the restaurant". We told him "friends" two times, but he must not have heard us. In any case, it's not something to get upset over, and the fact that he did so effortlessly isn't a sign that customer service is of value to their establishment.
author: Amy T.

description: Stopped in here for a bite and I must say that the cashier was beyond friendly and pleasant and knew how to find me the exact sandwich I'd like. Let's not forget how delicious the meal was. Highly recommend this place and hope to get back sooner than not. I wish they had a rewards incentive, because the sandwiches are awesome and I'd come back over some of those other local brands or chains.
author: Alex L.

description: I loved their sandwiches it was an Amazing experience i never knew stevensons 6th St would have an awesome eating place like that .all the Staff is super cooperative and best customer services ever. I will visit again with my girl. THANK you Cheez guys.
author: Frank W.

description: So awesome that there's finally a grilled cheese restaurant! Love this place, great staff!
author: Marcelo A.

description: Didn't know they had an amazing Grilled Cheese Shop on 6th and Stevenson in downtown sf. The staff and cashier were very friendly and out going and the Sandwhich was amazing, I tried the add ons and it was one of the Best sandwiches I've ever had thank you grilled cheez guys
author: Josh H.

description: Super friendly workers and one of the best grilled cheezes I've ever had! Will recommend to friends and I will definitely be returning!
author: Katelin M.

description: This place is a gem. Grilled cheeses are delicious and the people who work here are awesome. They even had a magician when I came by!
author: Josh Z.

description: Best grilled cheese I've had in my life, and I'm a bit of a grilled cheese connoisseur. Highly recommend the Nacho Guyz!
author: Connor A.

description:
Time Visited: 12noon
Time in Line: 0 minutes
How Long I Waited for Food: 0 minutes
Seated: @work
Traffic: Not Busy
Spent: $14

Ordered:
The Grilled Cheese Classic - Aged White&Yellow Cheese and Mozzarella ($9)
Add-On's: 
Avacado & Bacon ($5)

I know what you are thinking, "$14 for ONE sandwhich, that's crazy!" The sandwich is a good size. I shared a quarter of it with my co-worker. We both loved it! I would have ordered the candied jalapeno's, but they ran out by the time I got in line. On the side is a habanero jam, which is not at all spicy. The vendor's told us that it would "knock you on your butt". That it did not, but I do eat spicy quite often, so maybe the heat just didn't effect me. Anywho. The bread was perfectly crunchy, cheese was just gooey enough. I added a thai chili pepper to the jam. Dipped the sandwich into my modified jam and enjoyed every bite!

I docked down 1 stay because it is pretty pricey for just the sandwich. If they added even just a tiny side salad or celery and carrots, this would have been a 5 star review. 

I would go to this food truck every time if I saw it on the street. Keep up the good work Grilled Cheez Guy's. I hope to see you again!
author: Angelica R.

description: Great food and great service. Thank you for a great lunch the BTC was awesome. I will be back soon with my friends
author: Jose C.

description: Amazing yummy , melty cheesy perfection !! I've had a few of the sandwiches a craving another now !! I don't know if it's the gourmet cheese, the fancy bread , the way they cook it just golden perfect, but it is Scrumptious !! It's a pretty good size sandwich. Even cut in half, I save the rest for later. I had the classic - add bacon. Like a cheesy BLT !? Yum!! You could add basil, arugula, and even a spectacular jalapeño jelly that wasn't too spicy for me at all!! Just added a sweet jelly with a little pop!!  Can't wait for me next one !!
author: Heather D.

description:
These guys are obnoxious.  They reach out via Square for feedback, and I said that the sandwich was good but I thought it was a little overpriced for what it is.  I think its a little ridiculous to ask $1 for basil.... and $1 for arugula.  Till this day.... I have one of their guys writing to me, practically harassing me, about saying it was overpriced.......

I'm not gonna argue about Grilled Cheese.. lol... and I really don't appreciate seeing the Grilled Cheez Guys in my inbox over and over. 

Originally gave 2 stars since the sandwich was good, but now they're getting one for being annoying and rude.

Never will I get a grilled cheese from these guys again!
author: Stephanie B.

description: Hands down one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches I ever had to go along with excellent customer service. If you have not been here I strongly suggest that you go. You have no ideal what your missing!
author: Douglas S.

description:
If you don't feel like reading the whole thing.....gourmet grilled cheese at various locations in the bay area.  By far the best i have ever had.

Went to First Friday with some friends and after seeing this guy and his cheese mobile around town and the long lines at various events i took the plunge. I ordered a basic grilled cheese which i felt was the perfect thing to judge them on.  I believe the price was $8-9 which i thought was a little pricey for some bread and cheese but i was proven wrong.  This tantalizing treat for the taste budz had me singing its praises all weekend.  The buttery crispy bread, gooey cheese, and overall enjoyment i experienced rivaled that of that first time a young man is left at home alone with just his room and an old sock.  I do wish they had some sort of frequent cheeser club so my 5th sandwich could be $6 or something like that but i will pay the cheese gods what is needed for this treat any time i come across it again. 

Bottom Line:  Hands down the best grilled cheese you will eat!
author: Ted D.

description: These guys are great.  Not only was the grilled cheese top notch they were super cool about us hanging out there while we were filming a video in Stevenson alley.  Definitely recommended.
author: Kevin W.

description: THANK YOU ! We have a new option in town.  Good luck and best wishes on your business success..
author: Marco P.

description: Tried Grilled Cheez Guy at Off the Grid Presidio and will definitely have it again! I am a MAJOR grilled cheese lover and their's ranks in my top 5 best. I got a kids grilled cheese because I wasn't that hungry but it was still pretty big! I don't remember the exact price but I remember it being cheap, around $6. The bread was aaamazing as well.
author: Lauren M.

description: Straight from the truck, wasn't able to appreciate it as much with all the other food trucks competing for attention. Big chunks of bread with ample servings of melted cheese and add-ons of tomato being a favorite, and bacon a close second. Leftovers heated in a mini oven the day after really makes one appreciate how delicious these are.
author: Kimberly H.

description: This little shop is the best! There are no just grilled cheese spots in the city, aside chain restaurants, which aren't that great. So this place is unique in itself that it's the only one in SF of its kind and it's locally owned/ran. The portion sizes are hefty and the prices are slight...making this a place I'd go regularly. The habanero jelly and hot sauces are an amazing addition to the already fantastic sandwiches...so many different additions/combinations to try here. I had the BCT...bacon cheddar tomato. Would def like to try with arugula next time.
author: Carissa M.

description: I saw an ad for Grilled Cheez Guy in the paper so I decided to give it a try and I'm so glad I did! I got the grilled cheese nachos and they were amazing and a super cute idea. They weren't greasy at all. My boyfriend got the El Nino grilled cheese and said it was the best grilled cheese he's ever had. You can really tell they use high quality ingredients and you get good portion sizes. The people working there were also really friendly and helpful! I definitely plan on coming back!!
author: Anna R.

description: This is not the ordinary grilled cheese - it's quite a culinary experience! Fantastic blend of favors!!
author: Matt E.

description:
I HIGHLY recommend Grilled Cheez Guy! Their grilled cheese varieties are DELICIOUS and perfectly paired with the right cheese. 

I had them our for Company Quarterly All Hands & they were the quickest to serve. Definitely great if you are looking for a quick line.
author: Ivone P.

description: They had a stand at a beer festival I went to this weekend in Alameda. We thought they would be delicious because how do you screw up a grilled cheese? I'm not sure if it was just the people they had working at this stand or if they had stale bread with only the crusts available, but they were such a disappointment. I ordered 2 to share so we could each try a couple of different kinds. One was the ham and cheese with avocado added and the second was the classic with bacon added. Sounds delicious right? They weren't. They were so burnt and it was mainly just burnt bread crust. Couldn't taste the cheese, meat or $2 "avocado" spread because the burnt crusty flavor was so overpowering. Who uses the stale edges of the bread for a sandwich you're selling, and how did we end up with the end caps on all 4 slices of bread?! $23 for 2 burnt grilled cheese sandwiches. No thanks.
author: Amanda M.

description: The grilled cheese guy us a genius. Every ingredient is local and fresh. This guy puts thought into everything from the bread to the butter. Who would have thought you could make such a gourmet grilled cheese?! Definitely try the habanero jelly spread and if you like spice, try the kimchi spread. It's all to die for!
author: My-Oanh N.

description:
While visiting San Francisco my friends took us to Faction Brewing where she told us they also had the Grilled Cheez Guy's sitting outside w/ the best grilled cheese sandwiches around! I was super excited, I've always loved grilled cheeses!

We decided to go enjoy a few beers then go get a grilled cheese. Unfortunately, when we went out there, they had JUST sold out :( We were very disappointed but what can you do, things happen. 

Finishing up our friendly conversation with the gentleman we began to walk away when the other employee insisted we enjoy the sandwiches she had made for herself. Talk about great customer service! We offered to pay for the sandwiches but they didn't allow it. They were super friendly and the sandwiches were out of this world. 

One of the sandwiches had basil and the other had bacon! I honestly don't know exactly what they were but I do know that with their great customer service and amazing food this place is a MUST have!
author: Anita R.

description:
They were one of the longer lines at Off the Grid Presidio and I have this weird thing about if the line is long, it must be good if so many people are lining up for it. I decided to give it a chance as well and got the Frenchie grilled cheese with carmelized onions and greyuere. The bread was grilled nice and crispy, but it kind of overpowered the cheese, which was really good when I pulled the bread apart. I also got bacon for protein and it was really good. The bacon was cooked to a good crisp and it was tender and not too salty.

Overall, it was a good sandwich but I wish there was either more cheese or less bread.
author: Sophia Y.

description: These guy had a booth set up at First Friday, and just didn't have their act together. I waited in line for 20 minutes, only to have them tell me they couldn't process my credit card, despite indicating that they could on their sign. Too bad.
author: Jack M.

description: The best grilled cheese I have ever had. My husband is obsessed also. He went back for another- its that good! Thanks for being at brew fest so happy to run into your stand! These dudes rock!
author: Jes C.

description:
Unfortunately this review is a thumbs down. 

I booked this guy on short notice, was told we were good to go, only to be told the day before the event it wasn't going to happen. 

A total let down.
author: J C.

description: Crunchy. Cheesy. Zesty. Oh so tasty! My friends and I always storm The Grilled Cheez Guy when he's in our area. Why eat anything else when you could have a perfect grilled cheese sandwich with all the fixin's? Thank you Grilled Cheez Guy for making my day!
author: Kristen B.

description: OUTSTANDING!!!  First thing I noticed was the bread: it looked like naturally leavened sourdough(I'm a bread snob).  The butter and cheese are top quality and you can taste it.  Really, all the ingredients impressed me but let's be honest; a grilled cheese is usually known as a lazy sandwich, NOT HERE!  I'm gonna go ahead and say that it's probably the best sandwich I've EVER had. The owner told me it would change my life and he was right. I can't stop yapping about this sandwich to my friends and family.  I even went home and fed my sourdough starter. Well done guys!
author: Thomas H.

description: SOOOOO YUMMY!  I knew this guys grilled cheese were good... I mean he won a grilled cheese competition, but this was indescribable! I am a VERY picky eater and even more picky about my cheese... every bite was amazing! I had mine with tomato and bacon... how will you have yours?
author: Tabitha J.

description:
Had me some grilled cheez at the Rickshaw Stop for some event. They said they ran out, and then 20 minutes later they weren't sold out, and was pretty excited to fork over my monies for the cheez.

I got the Classic and it was just okay. Not bad, and thankfully they have good bread and sriracha to save their butts, but overall they just need more flavor. The cheese was placed somewhat unevenly and all of them had fairly mild flavors. The bread itself could have been grilled up a little crispier, and a little bit of salt (and a little more butter) could go a long way. At $8 for a mediocre grilled cheese sandwich they at least give a pretty large portion, however at $8 I could also make myself a very decadent and more delicious version of this.
author: Joanne Y.

description: The best grilled cheese ever! Seriously, melt in your face delicious. If you ever see this tent at an event, you better run over there. Can't wait to check out the restaurant.
author: Monika D.

description: Best grilled cheese in the bay hands down! Come to think about it, never have I had a better grilled cheese sandwich. I love this place. Top quality ingredients expertly prepared. Who could ask for more?
author: Mick H.

description:
The Grilled Cheez Guy aka Michael, was the easiest vendor I have ever worked with.
I called on a Monday for a Tuesday event, he called me back within the hour  and our grilled cheez gluttony was confirmed. The day of he used square to swipe my my card (he even accepts amex!) It was almost too easy.

Now, the grilled cheese was absolutely divine. Michael sources all of his products locally or in small batch. Acme bread, Berkeley bowl produce, cheese and mustard from Concord. It was gooey and delicious and worth a drive to Alameda or a visit to the Presidio to devour.

In addition to the outstanding service and most delicious sandwiches, Michael was fun and engaging telling jokes and explaining the products to everyone.

Our experience with the Grilled Cheez Guy was an absolute win and I would highly recommend him for any occasion or event.
author: Kirsten D.

description: Grilled cheese is delicious. Done right, it's buttery, crunchy bread filled with ooey gooey cheesyliciousness (now a word). For $10, I expected to bite into the *most* amazing, the *most* crunchy, the *most* ooey gooey cheesyliciousness of all time. Unfortunately, the "classic" grilled cheese disappointed. To its creator's credit, it's served on Acme levain bread, which is beloved in the Bay Area, and more than one type of cheese - cheddar, mozzarella, gruyere. Plus, you can add basil, bacon, and various condiments like sriracha. But a good grilled cheese should stand alone without any fancy dressings. The people who work here are SUPER nice, and grilled cheese always has potential, so I'll definitely go back to try another sandwich... maybe the Frenchie? No bricks used here, just a panini maker, but as long as it's delicious I don't care how its pressed!!
author: Ray J.

description: I didn't know grilled cheese could be like this. I lost count of the mouthgasms. Bliss.
author: Sophia H.

description: The best grilled cheese ever!!!!! The ingredients are as fresh as it gets and the cheese is melted perfectly! I got the original with arugula and heirloom tomatoes and topped it off with the habanero jelly, it's to die for. The portions are pretty big but you'll definitely enjoy every bite.
author: Jessica P.

description: Really solid grilled cheese. Thick, toasty, crusty bread, perfectly melted cheese and many addons - I opted for tomato. This came out to $10 which is a little much for bread, cheese and tomato, but I guess it's all part of the food truck thing. I especially like that they have sundried tomato ketchup and pepper jelly as condiments!
author: Amy Y.

description: Delicious, awesome bread sliced wide with lots of melted cheese inside. The sandwiches look beautiful and big with they way they cut the bread. Loved the classic. The one with roast beef isnt bad, just not a fan of the blue cheese dressing (can get it on the side).
author: Philip L.

description: He came to my school served everyone and and even gave free sandwiches this guy is AWSOME
author: Justin C.

description:
1 star for coordination / service / efficiency / knowing what's going on. My experiences are that they are generally overwhelmed and can't meet customer demand. 

4 stars for the food! Delicious. They use acme bread and have delicious combos of cheeses. The add-one are also nice. 

Personally, I won't be waiting in line again for these sandwiches.
author: Alison L.

description: The grilled cheese is AMAZING and the customer service is even better! I was able to experience the awesome grilled cheese and the orange blossom toffee (a bday gift ) while at uncorked. Worth EVERY calorie
author: See R.

description: Had the most delish grilled cheese sandwiches at the Yelp Spring Fling at the Oakland Museum yesterday. Clearly it had the longest line. Had several combos: Classic ham and cheese, ham, cheese and basil, pickled onions, etc.
author: Grace G.

description: Saw this outfit at "Off the Grid" last Friday and tried his toasted, peanut butter and jalapeno jelly sandwich. Absolutely FANTASTIC!!!! We're going to get this every time we leave "Off the Grid" for the ride home.
author: Marcus M.

description:
The only way this could be better is to be hungrier.
Perfectly browned crispy levain, cheese to die for, and guys that love what they're doing.
author: Michael H.

description:
Amazing grilled cheese sandwich! Was so worth the 20min wait at Yelp's SF Hornblower event today. Perfect blend of cheeses, nice use of Acme bread, great call on the tomato and basil fillings, and the balsamic vinaigrette was the "icing" to the sandwich.

Can't wait to frequent the pop-up & try their other types of grilled cheeses!
author: Ruth R.

description: We had the Grilled Cheez Guy out as an off the grid style fundraiser for a large company, He was nothing short of amazing! The portion size of these sandwiches were large which all of the manly men enjoyed! He busted them out so quick, I was tired just watching him. So thankful he was able to attend our event and will be working with him in the future!
author: Kelli W.

description:
I'm a big fan of grilled cheese, and I'm wholly in support of the movement to elevate the grilled cheese into a gourmet dish. (Though don't get me wrong--I'll happily jump at the opportunity to snack on a good old-fashioned grilled cheese with American cheese on white bread in a throwback to my childhood.)

I spotted The Grilled Cheez Guy at Oakland's Eat Real festival and immediately hopped in line to try his grilled cheese. 

The Grilled Cheez Guy was offering a combo with a grilled cheese sandwich, a tomato soup shooter and grilled peaches for $10. It was sunny and 80+ degrees out, so I passed on the tomato soup, and just ordered the sandwich and peaches.

The grilled cheese sandwich was definitely a step above--OK, many steps above--the ones I had as a kid. The humble presentation wrapped in brown butcher paper was a nice nostalgic touch that revealed the gourmet ingredients upon my first bite.

The grilled cheese was made on Acme bread, toasted to perfection so it was crispy outside--though a tad greasy, so I was appreciative of the paper wrapper. The cheese inside was a mix of cheddar cheeses, melted to gooey perfection. 

The peaches took a while--they had to be grilled perfectly tender--but they were so worth the wait. This popular dessert took halved peaches and stuffed them with goat cheese for the perfect combination of sweet and savory.

I'll definitely be keeping my eye out for The Grilled Cheez Guy at future foodie events. His grilled cheese was hands-down one of the best I've eaten all year.
author: Raul N.

description: The brick is the trick!!!  Indeed it's a trick to make the grilled cheese sammies the perfect crusts!!  I am a huge fan!  I also LOVE their pickles and their summer time grilled peaches!  I want some right now!  Make sure you follow him on FB and Twitter and see where he will be next!!
author: Simone F.

description:
Yummy grilled cheese, superior serving size and the use of Acme Bread make this place a winner. We tried the #1 which is a two cheese blend and is very yummy. The bread is perfectly toasted, crispy and not soft or soggy at all. Then we had the #5 which is pepper-jack, sliced jalapeños and two other cheeses. This one was also yummy and the peppers added a nice (mild) kick but I actually enjoyed the #1 better. The number 1 had a lovely blend of flavors that although mild, are noticeable and enjoyable on my palate. The service was fast, they arrived sooner than I expected, they looked great and were laid out very nicely tiered on the plate (I like this because the bottoms don't get soggy this way.

I intend on eating my way though their menu but for the moment #1 is my favorite.
author: Bob L.

description: I want to slap this guy across his stupid face his food is so good. Original sandwich, spread some orange habanero jelly on it and you're all set.
author: adam s.

description:
Our Company Winter Wonderland Party was a success! We wanted winter comfort food and The GrilledCheezGuy brought it filling the bellies of all our guests and making them very happy. We had The Caprese: mozzarella, tomato, and basil grilled cheese, The Dessert grilled cheese: brie and jam and powdered sugar and Shots of Miso Tomato Soup for dipping.

I have to hand it to Michael, not only did he serve a delicious ;9 menu, he also brought an additional idea to the table for our party by recommending Sugar & Spun's gourmet cotton candy. Nice touch! Everyone loved it.

We did have other food vendors serve our party but, I wanted to send out a special shout out to The GrilledCheezGuy. Thanks Michael! 

A tip for everyone, The GrilledCheezGuy grills require some power! So know your power capabilities. We had generators for our outdoor party.
author: Pamela D.

description: my "grilled cheese guy" experience @ "scoots"|san francisco launch party.  subject "grilled cheese guy's" arsenal of fabulous, succulent meats, on perfectly toasted "rye sourdough" is a world class epicurean experience.  in short:  artisan cheese akin to a "ben & jerry's" holistic eats!  "thanks for the "epicurean" memories! :-)
author: Will M.

description: Came to the popup in Hayes with a friend of mine on a random weekday afternoon. We walked right in without waiting. We were greeted by the owner and ordered the classic with tomato soup. It was delicious, definitely hit the spot! The owner and his staff were super sweet and friendly, kinda felt like we got the royal treatment but then again they seem to be slow that afternoon. Wish they were still at their popup in Hayes, I'm craving some grilled cheese from the Grilled Cheez Guy!
author: Poonam P.

description:
Michael served up some delicious sammies during our benefit concert last night at Firehouse 8. He was super easy to work with over email and he delivered exactly what I had hoped for and more. His grilled cheese not only hit the spot, they were really affordable and patrons were able to use their cards and cash for payment. Talk about easy! He doesn't require a ton of space for his operation, which means he fit in our event space perfectly and the delightful fragrance of melted cheese filled the entire place. He arrived right on time and was set up and ready for business shortly after.

I found out that Michael is a scientist by day, which explains how he was able to dream up with the perfect combination of ingredients to create a recipe of success. I wish I had another Classic in my hand right now! I recommend The GrilledCheezGuy for any occasion. Don't hesitate to book him.
author: Noel L.

description:
I biked past Grilled Cheez Guy during a rain storm two weeks ago. Tempted by the promise of warming up with hot tomato soup and grilled cheese, I ducked inside. I needed to get on my way to a meeting, so I asked if my to-go order could be packed well to survive a bike ride to SoMA. After they wrapped my soup with enough plastic wrap to repair Apollo 13, I was on my way. 

The soup was perfect. The sandwich was warm and melty. I was no longer cold and wet. I was warm and happy and full of gooey cheese, which is the best substance on the face of the earth. 

You should eat here.
author: Matthew H.

description: For two years in a row, the Grilled Cheez Guy has cooked up delicious food for our preschool auction fundraiser.  Michael is always accommodating, easy to work with, and just generally a good guy!  His food is fantastic, his prices are reasonable, and I recommend him wholeheartedly!  (Rumor has it he also makes a mean grilled PB&J!)
author: Betsey B.

description: Pretty good food but takes SOOOOOO long. Promise, look for some other food vendor... Nice dudes, but this is not worth the wait.
author: Sadie G.

description: I first discovered the Grilled CheezGuy at a tech event. I was impressed with their set up and even more impressed once I had tried the food. The sandwiches are not only delicious but I watched as cycle after cycle of fresh sandwiches disappeared in seconds. They worked incredibly hard to keep the sandwiches coming and the guests of the event left happy and full. I would definitely recommend trying one of these bad boys or using them for catering at your next event!
author: Sarah H.

description:
the grilled cheez guy was offering fried pickle, fried pickle slices (3), tomato soup shots(2) et al.

locale: art murmur 5/6

sampling: 1/2 grilled cheese (3)
-on acme pain au levin bread
-with carbo-aged cheedar
-tillamook shark cheese
-condensed milk mozzarrella
-pressurized by a foil wrapped brick while grilling.

footnotes:
-tastes good, not great
-me not a cheese aficonando.
-takes about 10 minutes grilling time.
-grilled cheze guy won lst place in l.a. cheese competition. (tropyy at stand),
author: Victor G.

description: Where do I begin??? The grilled cheese's were DELICIOUS!!!! We had the pleasure of having Michael and Justin cater our son's first birthday party in a local San Jose park. They are extremely flexible and cater to whatever you have in mind. The best part of their business is that they are a "part" of your party. They aren't your traditional food truck but more of a pop up shop which is so much better because they can mingle and be a part of your party. They arrived on time, are extremely professional and had a nice little set up with an EZ ups and their tables. We had selected 6 types of sandwiches and a side of chips and I can still taste the dessert grilled cheese in my mouth. The only thing I regret is not trying every sandwich. Michael's prices are super reasonable which was a great for us as we had him cater about 110 guests. Everyone left full and happy and I still keeping hearing about how yummy the sandwiches were every time I see someone that attended our party. He was also very accommodating to all my food requests and grilled the meat and veggie sandwiches separately. We have some egg and peanut allergies and he even catered to that. They brought plates, napkins, condiments and anything else you would need to serve food. It's amazing because you didn't have to worry about anything - just book them for you next event and see :) I can't wait to have him cater another one of our parties. Thank you both so much Michael and Justin!!!!
author: Harjeet J.

description:
I should have read the review with the "Meh" quote before trying this at the Eat Real Fest.

Glad I had people to share it with so that I did't have to eat the whole thing, and it was only half a sandwich.

The grilled peach with balsamic reduction and goat cheese was surprisingly delish, but peaches will not be in season much longer, and they are not the grilled peach guy...
author: Joe B.

description: If you ever want hassle-free turnkey noms for your event call Michael aka @GrilledCheezGuy not to mention the sammies are huge, filling, and the right degree of crunch to gooey cheeziness.  He's a regular at dorkbotSF keeping the dorks fed and happy all night long so the fact you can tweet your orders to him and pay via square is also nice.  It looks like he's expanded the menu too - aside from grilled cheese and tomato soupshots - there's now grilled cheese + meat and desert grilled sammies too.  He's more portable than a food truck/cart so can serve you on a boat even!
author: X X.

description: Had a sample slice at Yelp's Beerwalk Empire today and I'm sorry to say I was not impressed.  Perhaps it's because one of the three cheeses used was a goat cheese that left an I appealing after taste, or just that there was so much built up anticipation waiting so long.  I mean, the making of these sandwiches was such a production from the hand slicing of the cheese from huge blocks of cheese, to the slow cooking of these precious sandwiches pressed underneath foil wrapped weights.  Alas, the final product was a let down.
author: My H.

description:
I've encountered GrilledCheezGuy at several events now and have always been really, really happy with the sandwiches. They are delicious, reasonably priced, fast, and the owner is super genuine. In this era of delicious-yet-shockingly-expensive food carts and food trucks, GrilledCheezGuy is one of my absolute favorites.

(Another reviewer said the "Frenchy" sandwich with three cheeses and caramelized onions was their fave, I think I agree.)
author: Ralph M.

description: Best motherfucking grilledcheez in the East Bay.
author: Nelly M.

description: Top notch ingredients, top notch taste, and top notch service. It's hard to complain when you can't stop stuffing your face.
author: Barry W.

description: OK I'm not a big fan of grilled cheese sammiches but these guys are no joke. I saw these guys set up a table last year in San Francisco where they  were selling  3 cheese w/ Acme bread grilled cheese sandwiches.They also had soups but they were already sold out of the soups. Since I had not had dinner and was on the go for most of the day, they delivered in a big way!!!!! I've never had a grilled cheese sandwich like these guys did it. The cool part about the sandwich is that they gave you huge portions of cheese and big cut slices of bread only to smashed by a brick!!! WTF! Great concept & great idea and let's just say I ordered 2 of them bad boys and did not disappoint!!!! If you ever see these guys set up, I highly recommend giving them a taste!!!!
author: Richard G.

description: BEST EVER! he comes to our house and does holiday parties with us every year. Our guests love them and they make a badazz grilled cheese. DO IT DO IT DO IT!
author: Shoddy L.

description: This guy makes some legit grilled cheese. He uses all the best ingredients. He even use fresh acme bread. So good.!! Gotta try one of of these melty creations.
author: Jonathan K.

description: If you like delicious things that will rock your taste buds and then hold you afterwards and whisper sweet nothings in your ear, then get one of these sammies, stat! You might think you've had it all when it comes to grilled cheez, but get ready for perfection. Damn, now I'm getting hungry just thinking about these sandwiches. Damn you grilledcheezguy for being so good!!
author: Mona M.

description: "Meh. I've experienced better." Pretty much sums it up. Good bread grilled with Tillamook cheese that's it. Nothing fancy but also not that flavorful and definitely something any amature chef can make. $6 for a sandwich you could spruce it up and give me a paper plate or foil instead of napkins which stick to the cheese. $2 for a shot of watery bland tomato soup in a cold water cup. I wasn't sure if I was drinking tomato water or wax. Pickle was ok but was something you can buy from a jar at any deli. Surely not homemade. They pride themselves in the brick that they use to grill evenly. Nice technique for crunch but the end product was forgettable. Don't tell me you make the #1 best grilled cheese and about all your national recognition. If these are your products I call BS.
author: H Y.

description: Best ive ever had and ive had them all over the country. Truly the ambassador of grilled cheese.
author: John F.

description: GrilledCheezGuy grilled cheeses are bomb! I've tried many different kinds when I run into him at events, but the Frenchy one is hands down my favorite. It has mozz, gruyère, romano, and caramelized onions on huge thick slices of acme bread. Just make sure you get in line early so you don't miss out! This guy definitely needs a food truck or a restaurant because he has the right idea when it comes to grilled cheese.
author: Corey D.

description: I had the pleasure of having two grilled cheese sandwiches from The GrilledCheezGuy at last night's Bawdy Storytelling event.   Can I say DEEELICIOUS!!!?   I first tried the one that had chicken apple sausage, goat cheese, and irish cheddar.  Oh man, that was pretty yummy and totally hit the spot.  I love how Michael warns you it's hot when he hands you the sandwich.  So true, I had to blow on it a few times because the melted cheese was steaming.   Ooh,  i was salivating just waiting to take a bite into the sandwich.  Anyway, I couldn't help order another sandwich after seeing people go crazy for the "Frenchie" - a grilled cheese sandwich made with carmelized onions, gruyere, and mozzarella.  Hands down, that sandwich blew me away.  I was pretty full from the first sandwich, but yet, I was able to finish this one.  I woke up this morning craving a "Frenchie".   Why does the GrilledCheezGuy not yet have a brick and mortar store in SF???   He would give American Grilled Cheese a run for it's money.   Anyway, I'll have to hire TheGrilledCheezGuy for my next catering event.  I know he'll be a hit among my guest.   Till we meet again, TheGrilledCheezGuy...
author: Christine C.

description: GrilledCheezGuy saved my bacon by stepping in at the last minute when the food vendor I had originally booked for my wedding dropped out.  The food was fantastic - everybody was raving about it, the crew was professional and quick, the price very reasonable.  We had a great day and Michael was a major contributor to it.
author: Sonya B.

description: The GrilledCheezGuy came to our offices to serve lunch at a party for 50 people.  We could not believe how delicious the sandwiches were -- several varieties -- and how quickly he moved people through the line.   His tomato soup also was awesome, clearly made with fresh tomatoes.People were thrilled with the food and kept coming back for more.    Michael took care of everything and made our event so easy to do.  We'll have him back anytime!
author: Trish D.

description: GRILLED CHEEZ GUY is the best!  Michael showed up right on time, fully equipped with rolling carts of amazing stuff: peaches, fresh beets, amazingly fresh bread, homemade tomato soup, hot sauce....and of course cheeses of many varieties.  A fellow New Jersey native (bonus points in my book!), he's very personable and low-key, and very easy company.  He got to work right away in our kitchen, preparing bite-sized snacks for us and our guests to munch on - prosciutto, cheese bites, small sliced breads, fresh pickels....really good.  Then the main course - starting with sliced beets with salt and a little smoky cheese, followed by really tasty tomato soup, followed by a choice of mild grilled cheese or super spicy.  For dessert, Michael prepared grilled peaches with a little cheese on top - we almost fought for the last one, they were that good.  Michael handles all of the setup and cleanup and seems very comfortable hanging out in the background or joining the conversation with your friends - he seems to have an excellent sense about that.  He's also very open to discussing how he became the Grilled Cheese Guy and what he does for his day job as he pursues his dream of owning his own sandwich shop.  We all have ZERO doubt that Michael's skills, personality, and drive will get him there.  You will NOT be disappointed with Michael and his professional, polished service.
author: Rick K.
